title: Grateful Dead Live at The Scope on 1982-04-03
lineage: Transfer: MAC > Nakamichi CR-5A (Dolby-B in) > Edirol FA-66 > Wavelab 2448 > CD-Wave (24bit output) > TLH > FLAC 2448 tagged.
taper: Concert recording by Rip Tompkins, & with thanks to Richie Stankiewicz!

Comment
Jerry Garcia - Guitar
Bob Weir - Guitar
Brent Mydland - Keyboards
Phil Lesh - Bass
Bill Kreutzmann - Drums
Mickey Hart - Drums

reviews.review_text: Wonderful recording. Also, the humanity! This is a wonderful recording and a really nice show with some excellent surprises. A few moments of confusion, but you'll have that. Not being as well-versed on the 1982 era some of the freshness may be a function of ignorance, but so far, so good. Starting to get into this period. Someone, somewhere, said this is the first show where Jer and Phil changed sides. A contributing factor to some of the new moves, perhaps. Phil's phased bass during Loser is interesting and takes that song into something I'd never heard before, and that's one of my favorite tunes. All I wanna know is, who's the asshole griping throughout the Scarlet/Fire jam about people standing up? Jeez, man. Give it a rest. The Scarlet Fire jam is short, but unique to these ears and definitely worth the the time. It's a direction I've never heard them take to connect those songs before. A lot of pleasure to be had here. Thank you!
